captions.text:
There are no motorcycle reviews involved in
this instalment of The Man with the Golden Suit.

In this episode, we will be talking about
some of those tips and tricks to survive the traffic.

As we ride the bike, there is a fundamental
technique we should be concerned about.

When we say 'technique' it is actually a bit of
an exaggerated term. It's simply talking to yourself throughout your ride.

What sets our speed as we go down a street
or a road? How do we decide?
That speed limit sign over there?
Or the top speed of our bike?
Or else, do we just plough through it all at full whack without any regards to any of the risks?

So we'll be talking about these things; how
we should go, how fast we should go,
filtering through traffic jams or going down a side street... How should we ride?
So I am about to join a main road...
Slowing down here, checkin' me left first, having a good look... Then the right, all is good...Go for it.

Then we have these other things to address...
For instance, a disciplined approach to junctions.

As you all know, fucking around on junctions
fucks you off to a bitter end.

Look at this now... The junction system!..
Everybody eyeballs each other you see?
Everybody just gauges each other, no rules... That's the way in Turkey.
Look, now we are approaching the roundabout...
Nobody knows who has the right to pass, everybody is flooring and going for it...

Lookit that animal, f..king grisly...
A film about love! ....
Look, we got some water going around the roundabout... Why? Cause our department for culture, media and sports fancies the patch of grass more than human life.

Now, now... I slow down... They're joining
from right you see, watching out...
The woman didn't notice me, no eye contact, hence I'm not noticed... Hence, the horn.
How did I get it was a female driver? From that tight fist wringing the steering wheel
as if it's going anywhere... Look... Hah, ok, the auntie's a bit relaxed now.

So we're scanning around, all the time...
Here, a petrol station exit...
There's a good bit of jumping into the traffic around these ones. Checking, sounding the horn...
to say I'm here. I don't just go through assuming they see me, never.

Now, more joining from the right, checking...
Our speeds match, good... OK.
Checking right mirror, good... Checking left mirror, good.

Continuing from the right hand lane but there's
a connection ahead on the left, sorry, on the right...

They'll turn off to join the
motorway so they is a good chance they plough through the lanes from the far left as this is Turkey.
So what do we do? We use the middle lane, down the middle here.
So, even if my vehicle happens to be a wee one I puff myself up and...

claim some presence down the middle
you see. This is also a motor vehicle yo, I also gots them rights.
So the right hand lane is available, there's no danger, check, Change lane... On the right.
Checking the right, carriageway joining..Avoid the pothole...
Approach right... Is there an opening, yup, there it is let's go...

Ok, so green light... Green doesn't mean we
can launch just like that... Always check

around first. You trust the green one and
pass only to meet some oaf jumping onto the road to get T-boned.

So the green light is
never a free pass really. There are so many
that don't care about the green light.

So, I'm following the left here because the
right...
You see, he doesn't even mind looking before joining the road. This is the standard attitude of our taxi drivers.

Going down a calm, empty road... Traffic lights
ahead... The lights are at green but the traffic

is jammed... So I'm not opening the throttle
much as I am about to brake anyway.

My purpose here is something like, gauging where to filter
through on one hand and checking the potential hazards on the other.

For instance, as you
can see here, an easy lad... Mind you, a pedestrian
lad, spreading it out onto the road.

We are gonna go down this bit but can't because
this grizzly friend seems to have parked and

checked out no worries... Or is he... There
he is, sitting... Must be too difficult for

him to inch forward a little... Checking his
tablet, see that?
We are approaching the traffic at 4 Levent...
We shouldn't forget there are two large tube stations on the right here, plus others joining from the motorway...
Look at them, stepping
on it to crash into the inner city traffic.
All kinds here; ones who cut you off for a right turn without checking... We got allsorts of them around here...

Ones who stop in the middle of the road just like that...
SUVs with no rear window... Everyone is here,you know.

Here we have f....s who cut down the junction
playing with their phones...... .....
Woa... Look them jokes. Our daughter is a new driver, her uncle Rifki.

Had Uncle Rifki known what the wee daughter's
up to with her driving...
Even if we had worn one of those hi-vis highway maintenance bibs, it's still no good unless our positioning in the lane is correct...
For instance, if we only scuttle down the side like this, they'd be right on top of us trying to shoulder their way in for a pass.

That's why, you gotta mark your territory
claiming your right to pass down this lane.

You have to present yourself with enough confidence
to raise enough for the other road users to leave you alone.

If you fail to do so, they'll
start pushing you out their way.

We are on location at Istanbul's most disastrous,
worst planned and built, most disorganised bit...

The dude that's coming in from the
south is trying to make a right...

The dude who's approaching Zincirlikuyu from Mecidiyekoy
direction is trying to make a left...

Therefore,everybody runs into each other down this 100-150
meters of stretch.
We don't want you to be one of those noobs who jump into the traffic without really learning how to control this machine,

cutting everyone
else passing their judgement about how dangerous

motorcycles are after breaking their legs
at the first junction crashing out...

Because the machine itself is actually pretty safe...
Only these ones are not so safe...

Here, these...And the ones that planned and built these
roads.
Therefore we have to claim some more responsibility.
We are smarter than they are, we have more skills than they have and we have more balls than they do.

Please survive, to enjoy riding a motorcycle
for life. See you next time

title: Trafikte Motosiklet (ENG Subtitle, Scooter Riding in Istanbul)
